meanings.sent1: She was emblematizing her love for nature by painting a tree on her wall.
meanings.sent2: The flag emblematizing the country's freedom waved proudly in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The artist emblematizing a banana as a symbol of happiness made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: His actions were emblematizing the courage of a lion in the face of danger.
meanings.sent5: The statue emblematizing peace stood tall in the center of the park.

meanings.definition: To serve as an emblem or symbol
meanings.sent1: The dove emblematizing peace was a common motif in her artwork.
meanings.sent2: The ancient artifact emblematizing power was displayed in the museum.
meanings.sent3: The crown emblematizing royalty was too heavy for the little girl to wear.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse emblematizing hope guided ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent5: The tree emblematizing growth and strength was planted in the town square.
